item.title: General Session with Hugo Bascur
item.description: UWSD Crew's PERFORMANCE TEAM sign ups for Fall 2025 are now live! Link to sign up in our bio. There are 3 teams open for registration: 1. Locking + House Team 2. Popping Team 3. Hip hop Team Practices start up next week (week of Oct 20). Free of charge. No audition required. Side note: @hugobascur will be teaching this Wednesday during our general session in the SLC lower atrium. Try showing up if you're interested in joining the Popping team!

item.title: Equity in Action: Building Inclusive Communities in Waterloo
item.description: ðŸŒ Equity in Action: Building Inclusive Communities in Waterloo Join us on Oct 22 (4:30â€“5:30 PM) for a powerful panel bringing together voices from the Cambridge Womenâ€™s Shelter, Canadian Federation of University Women, and student advocates. ðŸ§¡ Explore what equity really means in our community from housing and education to tackling gender-based challenges and discover how you can take action through advocacy, volunteering, and everyday choices. Letâ€™s build a more equitable Waterloo, together. Register now to secure your spot for a truly enlightening talk and to make some new connections! Open to women and non-binary folks.

item.title: Co-Op Workplace Simulation
item.description: Want to level up your co-op experience and impress your next employer? On October 22 join Velocity at the Co-op Workplace Simulation. This event is open to all students from any faculty or program. This is not just another workshop, itâ€™s a dynamic simulation where youâ€™ll role-play real-world scenarios using AI tools. Youâ€™ll step into the shoes of a co-op student working for an employer in any industry, spot a challenge, and learn how to bring your innovative solution to your employer - confidently and effectively. Register at the link in our bio!

item.title: Art Installation
item.description: New art. Sweet cupcakes. No sign-up needed. Come celebrate the RADD ART installation with WiCS! Join us in celebrating the installation of art generously donated by RADD ART. Enjoy complimentary red velvet cupcakes!

item.title: Biodiversity Conservation and Restoration Research Talk
item.description: Join us next Thursday October 23rd, 12:00 - 1:00 in EV1-136 for a research talk with Dr. Tim Alamenciak! He will share his work on conservation engagement in the Canadian prairies with Ducks Unlimited, cutting edge research into the use of LLMs for evidence synthesis in restoration and conservation ecology, and ongoing efforts to build communities of practice that bridge researchers and practitioners. Students will learn about findings that inform how we can engage more people in conservation and restoration work. Tim will also share opportunities for final-year thesis projects and a funded PhD opportunity. Hope to see you there ðŸŒ¿

item.title: Open House
item.description:
Come join our celebration of APL history at the Computer Museum Open House on Saturday, October 25, 2025!
The event will be held in the Davis Centre "Fishbowl" (DC 1301), and will run from 11:00am to 4:00pm. We will have various APL-related artifacts on display, along with interactive retro computers and some of our recent acquisitions. There will be guest exhibits from the KW Computer Heritage Group as well as mathematics alumni Steve McDowell joining us at 1:30PM to talk about his experiences as one of the developers of Waterloo microAPL: The Story of Waterloo microAPL.
Our Open House is free to attend, and all visitors are welcome!

item.title: Divest Now
item.description:
UW DISCLOSED, AND ITâ€™S EVEN WORSE THAN WE THOUGHT
At more than $200 million invested, the University of Waterloo ranks among the worst university offenders of complicity in the genocide.
The students forced UW to drop Technion, and we will force the Board of Butchers to divest.
ðŸš¨ TAKE ACTION NOW ðŸš¨ ALL OUT OCTOBER 27th: DIVEST OR WEâ€™LL DISMANTLE
Join us on Monday, October 27th to demand divestment and a complete end to UWaterlooâ€™s complicity in genocide and occupation.
The students demand divestment now, and we will not rest until UW divests every last dollar they have in companies aiding the Zionist entity, until UW ceases all support for genocide and occupation and until total liberation and return.

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:

item.title: Prod Night - Halloween Issue
item.description: 159.3, fresh off the presses! (Reenactment, not actually how we get our issues.) Come get them now! Oh, wait, what's that? No prod night in two weeks?! I need to wait an extra one?!!! Noooo!!!!! Next prod night on October 27th, 6:30PM, QNC 1502. Halloween issue!!!!!!! Be there :3

item.title: Building with MCP

item.title: Halloween Showdown
item.description: Step right up and test your skills in a spooky showdown! Cats, bats, ghosts, and creepy crawlies wait for you to build a team in this singles point buy tournament. A spooky Cyndaquil plush will be awarded to the winner! Not confident on which teams are tricks or treats? Sample teams will be provided on our discord or on the day of if need be! The list of available Pokemon can be found on the second slide or on our Discord. The format will be nat dex singles with bans on megas and Z moves. Tera will also be allowed! 7 points are allowed for you to budget and build your team. Join our Discord or DM us on insta for more details.

item.title: StreetÂ·oÂ·logy
item.description: Jane Street is hosting a virtual info session with insights on navigating the recruiting process! They'll share practical advice and best practices for managing timelines, deadlines, and offers to help you approach your job search with confidence. While this session will be especially beneficial for underclassmen beginning their internship search, the guidance applies to anyone pursuing internships or full-time positions. Sign up to gain useful perspectives that can make a difference in your approach to recruiting. Wednesday, October 29 6:00pm - 7:30pm ET Zoom details will be shared upon participation confirmation!

item.title: Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation
item.description:
ðŸŒ Sustainability goes beyond recycling bins; it's also about how we care for our bodies and communities.
Join us in exploring how sustainability, period poverty, and menstrual equity intersect in the next installment of the Menstrual Equity Series, "Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation"!
ðŸ’¡Hosted by Karen Farley (they/their) Environmental researcher and recent master's graduate, Karen's findings led to the creation of "Period Pin", an online map connecting menstruators to over 2,000 product locations across Canada.
**Registration link in bio
ðŸ“† Tuesday, November 4th! ðŸ“Online

item.title: Battle of the Jazz Bands
item.description: Its the event of the season! Come watch jazz bands from the University of Toronto, McMaster University and the University of Waterloo battle it out on the Hagey Hall Theater stage from 2:00-4:30 pm on November 9th. This will be our largest event yet and definitely the first of its kind. Bring everyone you know to attend this FREE concert.

item.title: Co-Op Workplace Simulation
item.description: Want to level up your co-op experience and impress your next employer? On October 22 join Velocity at the Co-op Workplace Simulation. This event is open to all students from any faculty or program. This is not just another workshop, itâ€™s a dynamic simulation where youâ€™ll role-play real-world scenarios using AI tools. Youâ€™ll step into the shoes of a co-op student working for an employer in any industry, spot a challenge, and learn how to bring your innovative solution to your employer - confidently and effectively. Register at the link in our bio!

item.title: STANK: Serve's Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition
item.description: ðŸ¥§ Prepare for a Feast of Fierce Volleyball! ðŸ¦ƒ As the leaves turn and the holiday spirit fills the air, itâ€™s time for STANK: Serveâ€™s Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition! Gather your team, bring your best plays, and get ready to serve up gratitude with spikes, digs, and fierce rallies. Letâ€™s celebrate the season with some friendly competition and a full plate of fun! Event Details: ðŸ Date: Saturday, November 15th-16th (Overnight) â° Time: 8pm to 8am ðŸ“ Location: PAC Main Gym + Small Gym ðŸ‚ Team Sign-Up Form your crew of 6 to 9 players (only UWaterloo students with a valid athletics membership or alumni with a day pass) and choose your division: semi-competitive or competitive. Co-ed rules apply: all teams must have at least 2 female-identifying players on the court at all times. (Note: A female libero is required to serve for a middle.) âš ï¸ NEW Semi-Comp Sign-Up Rules (Read Carefully!) To keep play balanced and fair this season: - Any male-identifying player rated Level 5 or of Level 5 ability must set or lib on a semi-comp team. - If you attended UW prior to the 5-level system (graduated before Fall 2023), the same rule applies if you were rated Level 4. - Spring levels are not included in this consideration. - If thereâ€™s any confusion, please reach out to an exec for clarification. - If your team has a Level 5 male player signed up for semi-comp, contact an exec to verify the validity of your team. - Players who are not evaluated this term may be removed from your team on the day of or asked to set/lib if necessary. ðŸ’° Pricing Regular (still fresh out of the coop): Register by Nov 3rd for $200 Both the form and payment must be completed by Nov 3rd @ 11:59pm. ðŸ“ How to Register Make your payment: https://warrior.uwaterloo.ca/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e7072bd1-0754-4e99-9fbe-04a18228cfe1 Fill out the form: https://forms.office.com/r/twpLDkzmhD @everyone ðŸ Letâ€™s spice up the season, rally together, and make this Thanksgiving one to remember!
